sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: This is Euronews now, I'm Helena Humphrey, and here are your top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Kiev says it's uncovered a mass grave that could contain hundreds of its soldiers and civilians in the eastern town of Izum, recently liberated by Ukrainian forces.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: A parliamentary inquiry in Italy has concluded that a third ship caused the collision and sinking of the Moby Prince ferry 30 years ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And after a massive drop in tourism due to the pandemic, foreign visitors are returning to Turkey, but hospitality businesses are facing different challenges.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian authorities say they have found a mass grave close to the recently recaptured town of Izyum in the Kharkiv region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: A makeshift wooden headstone indicates that the bodies of 17 Ukrainian soldiers are buried in this forest.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But the Ukrainian commissioner for missing persons says there is evidence of hundreds of bodies, including civilians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: There is evidence of hundreds of bodies, including civilians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: We want the world to know what is really happening and what the Russian occupation has led to.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Bucha, Mariupol and now, unfortunately, Izium.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Russia leaves death everywhere and must be responsible for it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The world must hold Russia accountable for this war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: We will do everything for this.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has also said that investigations into the mass grave have begun.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Russian forces left Izium last week and other parts of the Kharkiv region after a massive Ukrainian counter-offensive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Vladimir Putin is seeking support from his allies as he looks to bolster Russia's position on the world stage following its invasion of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Putin said he was ready to discuss China's concerns about the war as he spoke to President Xi Jinping at a summit this week. The response was mixed, a promise of support for Russia's key interests, alongside a stress on the respect for national sovereignty. Putin also mingled with leaders of India, Pakistan and four ex-Soviet countries at the Shanghai Cooperation Organization in Uzbekistan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It was also a chance for his key ally, Belarus, to strengthen ties with China.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: President Alexander Lukashenko reportedly praised the reliable friendship of his counterpart.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The eight-state security alliance, set up in 2001 as a counterweight to U.S. influence in global affairs, offered Asian states a forum for other conflicts too. After fierce fighting with Armenian neighbors that left over a hundred and fifty soldiers dead this week, Azerbaijan leader Ilham Aliyev met with Turkey's president Recep Tayyip Erdogan. The pair are long-term allies. Turkey's foreign minister said ahead of the meeting that it will continue to stand by Azerbaijan after its worst flare-up in violence with Armenia since 2020.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Tourism in Turkey is rebounding.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: After a massive drop due to the COVID-19 pandemic, foreign visitors are a major source of income for Niko Valdez's fish restaurant on the shore of Istanbul's Bosphorus Strait.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But it's facing some different challenges this year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We have a big problem with credit cards.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Russian people coming to the restaurant want to use their credit cards to pay, but they don't work.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: I'm not happy about it, nor am I guess.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It's a difficult situation for Russians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Russian tourists continue to come to Turkey while the EU is tightening rules around them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: That's after Ukraine's government urged the EU and the G7 to ban them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's foreign ministry didn't respond to requests for comment from Euronews about whether Turkey should do the same.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Turkey has played a unique role in the war in Ukraine, both providing drones to Ukraine while also maintaining a relationship with Russia, especially a financial one. This is the yacht believed to belong to Dmitry Kamanchik on Turkey's popular southern coast. It's one of several yachts owned by Russian oligarchs reported to have docked in Turkey following Western sanctions on Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The U.S. warned in August there was a risk of penalties for Turkish companies if they worked with sanctioned individuals.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Ankara dismissed the concerns, stating it would improve trade with its neighbors while not going against sanctions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Any business Turkey can get is vital for its embattled economy that is now seeing an official inflation rate of more than 80%.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: That has put major strain on Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan's popularity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Economist John Seljuk said tourism revenue is especially important this season as Erdogan is set to face his most difficult election next year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Given the macroeconomics in Turkey right now and the dire need for any kind of exchange currency in Turkey, I would say that Russian tourists are very important.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: For Valdez he says Russians account for about half of his business we have a very bad economy but Russian tourists coming here means we can earn money which is good very nice Christina Jovanovski Euronews Istanbul in 1991 one of Italy's worst maritime Istanbul.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In 1991, one of Italy's worst maritime accidents occurred.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The ferry, the Moby Prince, collided with an anchored oil ship, the Egypt Abruzzo, killing 140 and causing extreme environmental damage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But now, over 30 years later, a parliamentary inquiry has concluded that a third ship caused the collision.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: According to the final report, this ship suddenly appeared in front of the ferry as it was departing Livorno, forcing it to make a left turn that pushed it towards the tanker.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: However, it has not yet been possible to identify which boat this was.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The Moby Prince was headed to Olbia in Sardinia when its brutal change in direction caused it to rip through one of the Ajepa Ruzo's cargo tanks. Crude oil then spilled into the sea and onto the ferry's deck where it went up in flames. Most of the people on board died of carbon monoxide poisoning. The tanker's crew were all rescued. The probe into the Moby Prince disaster was reopened in July 2021, after legislators realized the initial investigations did not identify the exact cause of the tragedy. One of Russia's last independent media sources has had its license

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: revoked, according to the publication itself. The move, which will block the online version of Novaya Gazeta, comes days after a Moscow district court blocked the newspaper's print version and after the country's media watchdog accused it of violating Moscow's restrictions on labeling so-called foreign agents.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: U.S. billionaire Yvon Chouinard has given away his fortune to save planet Earth.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The founder of the outdoor retailer Patagonia, valued at 3 billion euros, has given 100% of his shares to a trust in charge of ensuring the brand's environmental values are respected and a non-profit dedicated to fighting against climate change.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The 83-year-old says he hopes his move will influence a new form of capitalism.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The 83-year-old says he hopes his move will influence a new form of capitalism.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Hours go by and the queue in London to pay tribute to the late monarch, Queen Elizabeth II, does not go down. People have turned up in the thousands to bid her farewell.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Yet despite the waiting times, the atmosphere is peaceful and solemn. Very quiet, very respectful.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Nobody was talking, really.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Just people paying their respects, really.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: And quite moving.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It's been a wonderful experience.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We've come, we've said goodbye.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We wanted to pay our respect, and that's what we've done.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: I know I've never met her face to face, but it's like she was a grandma. I see her as a grandma to me and she was a wonderful, strong, powerful lady. A minute's silence was also held for her at the United Nations and its Secretary General Antonio Guterres spoke of her legacy and important role. The first part of a remarkable reign saw many nations gaining independence from Britain and the formation of the Commonwealth, a diverse multilateral group.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Commonwealth members are among the most steadfast supporters of the United Nations and we mourn with them also today.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile the new heir to the throne, the Prince of Wales, and his wife were in Sandringham, one of the royal family's residences, to thank locals for their continued support and tributes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Stay with us.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We're back after a short break.
